intro: Harrisonia abyssinica f. grandifolia, commonly known as the Ethiopian harrisonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Celastraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest habitats across Ethiopia and Eritrea. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
